page.title: 10THE BEEFEATER, HOCKLIFFE
page.content: The{Beefeater}still has its former sign the{'White Hart'.}It has been a {steak house}for 12 months. The customers are mainly locals from {Hockliffe}or people using the{A5.}The average bill is about Â£25 for a family of 4. Food is mostly frozen, but meat is fresh. Of 26 employees most are local. About 1000 meals a week are served. Employees work about{16-17 hours}a day. More adults come in than children. The change from pub to{steak {house}has been important in providing local work especially for women in an area where the population has remained relatively stable. Special treats include{free strawberries in the summer,{free badges and{free}trips to{Whipsnade {Zoo.}There are about{170 Beefeaters}in {Britain}and{1}in{Belgium.
